pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:0.4.eng: 10. The training rule on schism in the Sangha

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.2.pli: Atha kho devadatto yena kokāliko kaṭamodakatissako khaṇḍadeviyā putto samuddadatto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā kokālikaṃ kaṭamodakatissakaṃ khaṇḍadeviyā puttaṃ samuddadattaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.2.eng: Devadatta went to Kokālika, Kaṭamodakatissaka, Khaṇḍadeviyāputta, and Samuddadatta. He said to them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.3.pli: “etha mayaṃ, āvuso, samaṇassa gotamassa saṅghabhedaṃ karissāma cakkabhedan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.3.eng: “Let’s cause a schism in the Sangha of the ascetic Gotama. Let’s break its authority.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.3.comm: “Break its authority” renders cakkabheda. Sp 1.410: Cakkabhedāyāti āṇābhedāya, “Cakkabhedāya: by breaking the authority.” Vjb 4.343: Cakkabhedanti sāsanabhedaṁ, “Cakkabheda: a break in the instruction.” The break in authority is presumably both from the Buddha and the Sangha. Although the Buddha was the only authority in laying down rules, the Sangha was autonomous in its decision making. For practical purposes, it was the Sangha that Devadatta was breaking with.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.5.eng: “The ascetic Gotama is powerful and mighty.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.6.pli: Kathaṃ mayaṃ samaṇassa gotamassa saṅghabhedaṃ karissāma cakkabhedan”ti?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.7.pli: “Etha mayaṃ, āvuso, samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ upasaṅkamitvā pañca vatthūni yācissāma—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.7.eng: “Well, let’s go to the ascetic Gotama and request five things:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.8.pli: ‘bhagavā, bhante, anekapariyāyena appicchassa santuṭṭhassa sallekhassa dhutassa pāsādikassa apacayassa vīriyārambhassa vaṇṇavādī.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.8.eng: ‘In many ways, sir, you praise fewness of wishes, contentment, self-effacement, ascetic practices, being inspiring, the reduction in things, and being energetic.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.9.pli: Imāni, bhante, pañca vatthūni anekapariyāyena appicchatāya santuṭṭhiyā sallekhāya dhutatāya pāsādikatāya apacayāya vīriyārambhāya saṃvattanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.9.eng: And there are five things that lead to just that:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.11.eng: if the monks stayed in the wilderness for life,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.12.pli: yo gāmantaṃ osareyya, vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.12.eng: and whoever stayed near an inhabited area would commit an offense

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.13.eng: if they ate only almsfood for life,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.14.pli: yo nimantanaṃ sādiyeyya, vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.14.eng: and whoever accepted an invitational meal would commit an offense

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.15.eng: if they were rag-robe wearers for life,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.16.pli: yo gahapaticīvaraṃ sādiyeyya, vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.16.eng: and whoever accepted robe-cloth from a householder would commit an offense

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.17.eng: if they lived at the foot of a tree for life,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.18.pli: yo channaṃ upagaccheyya, vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.18.eng: and whoever took shelter would commit an offense

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.19.eng: if they didn’t eat fish or meat for life,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.20.pli: yo macchamaṃsaṃ khādeyya, vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyyā’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.20.eng: and whoever did would commit an offense.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.21.eng: The ascetic Gotama won’t allow this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.22.pli: Te mayaṃ imehi pañcahi vatthūhi janaṃ saññāpessāmāti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.22.eng: We’ll then be able to win people over with these five points.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.23.pli: Sakkā kho, āvuso, imehi pañcahi vatthūhi samaṇassa gotamassa saṅghabhedo kātuṃ cakkabhedo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.23.eng: Kokālika said, “It might be possible to cause a schism in the Sangha with these five points,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.24.eng: for people have confidence in austerity.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.1.pli: Atha kho devadatto sapariso yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.1.eng: Devadatta and his followers then went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho devadatto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.5.pli: Imāni, bhante, pañca vatthūni anekapariyāyena appicchatāya …pe…

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.7.pli: Sādhu, bhante, bhikkhū yāvajīvaṃ āraññikā assu;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.8.pli: yo gāmantaṃ osareyya vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyya …pe…

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.9.pli: yāvajīvaṃ macchamaṃsaṃ na khādeyyuṃ, yo macchamaṃsaṃ khādeyya vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyyā”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.11.pli: yo icchati āraññiko hotu, yo icchati gāmante viharatu;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.11.eng: Those who wish may stay in the wilderness, and those who wish may live near inhabited areas.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.11.comm: “Inhabited area” renders gāma. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.12.pli: yo icchati piṇḍapātiko hotu, yo icchati nimantanaṃ sādiyatu;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.12.eng: Those who wish may eat only almsfood, and those who wish may accept invitational meals.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.13.pli: yo icchati paṃsukūliko hotu, yo icchati gahapaticīvaraṃ sādiyatu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.13.eng: Those who wish may be rag-robe wearers, and those who wish may accept robe-cloth from householders.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.14.pli: Aṭṭhamāse kho mayā, devadatta, rukkhamūlasenāsanaṃ anuññātaṃ, tikoṭiparisuddhaṃ macchamaṃsaṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.14.eng: I have allowed the foot of a tree as a resting place for eight months of the year, as well as fish and meat that are pure in three respects:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.15.eng: one hasn’t seen, heard, or suspected that the animal was specifically killed to feed a monastic.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.17.pli: “na bhagavā imāni pañca vatthūni anujānātī”ti haṭṭho udaggo sapariso uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.17.eng: “The Buddha doesn’t allow the five points.” Glad and elated, he got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left with his followers.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.18.pli: Atha kho devadatto sapariso rājagahaṃ pavisitvā pañcahi vatthūhi janaṃ saññāpesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.18.eng: Devadatta then entered Rājagaha and won people over with the five points,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.19.pli: “mayaṃ, āvuso, samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ upasaṅkamitvā pañca vatthūni yācimhā—

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.20.pli: ‘bhagavā, bhante, anekapariyāyena appicchassa santuṭṭhassa sallekhassa dhutassa pāsādikassa apacayassa vīriyārambhassa vaṇṇavādī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.21.pli: Imāni, bhante, pañca vatthūni anekapariyāyena appicchatāya santuṭṭhiyā sallekhāya dhutatāya pāsādikatāya apacayāya vīriyārambhāya saṃvattanti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.22.pli: Sādhu, bhante, bhikkhū yāvajīvaṃ āraññikā assu;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.23.pli: yo gāmantaṃ osareyya, vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyya.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.25.pli: yo nimantanaṃ sādiyeyya, vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyya.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.27.pli: yo gahapaticīvaraṃ sādiyeyya, vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyya.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.29.pli: yo channaṃ upagaccheyya, vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyya.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.31.pli: yo macchamaṃsaṃ khādeyya, vajjaṃ naṃ phuseyyā’ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.32.eng: saying, “The ascetic Gotama doesn’t agree to them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.33.pli: Te mayaṃ imehi pañcahi vatthūhi samādāya vattāmā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.2.33.eng: but we practice in accordance with them.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.1.pli: Tattha ye te manussā assaddhā appasannā dubbuddhino te evamāhaṃsu—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.1.eng: The foolish people with little faith and confidence said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.2.eng: “These Sakyan monastics are practicing asceticism and living with the aim of self-effacement.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.3.pli: samaṇo pana gotamo bāhulliko bāhullāya cetetī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.3.eng: But the ascetic Gotama is extravagant and has chosen a life of indulgence.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.4.pli: Ye pana te manussā saddhā pasannā paṇḍitā byattā buddhimanto te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.4.eng: But the wise people who had faith and confidence complained and criticized Devadatta,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma devadatto bhagavato saṅghabhedāya parakkamissati cakkabhedāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.5.eng: “How can Devadatta pursue schism in the Sangha of the Buddha? How can he break its authority?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.5.comm: For the further development of these events, see Kd 17:2.11–4.5.15.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.6.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.6.eng: The monks heard the criticism of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.7.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.7.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized him

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.9.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū devadattaṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.9.eng: After rebuking Devadatta in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.10.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, devadatta, saṅghabhedāya parakkamasi cakkabhedāyā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.10.eng: “Is it true, Devadatta, that you are doing this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.13.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, saṅghabhedāya parakkamissasi cakkabhedāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.13.eng: “Foolish man, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.15.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.15.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.16.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu samaggassa saṅghassa bhedāya parakkameyya, bhedanasaṃvattanikaṃ vā adhikaraṇaṃ samādāya paggayha tiṭṭheyya, so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.16.1.eng: ‘If a monk pursues schism in a united Sangha or persists in taking up a legal issue conducive to schism, the monks should correct him like this,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.17.pli: ‘māyasmā samaggassa saṅghassa bhedāya parakkami, bhedanasaṃvattanikaṃ vā adhikaraṇaṃ samādāya paggayha aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.17.eng: “Venerable, don’t pursue schism in the united Sangha or persist in taking up a legal issue conducive to schism.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.18.pli: Sametāyasmā saṅghena. Samaggo hi saṅgho sammodamāno avivadamāno ekuddeso phāsu viharatī’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.18.eng: Stay with the Sangha, for a united Sangha—in concord, in harmony, having a joint recitation—is at ease.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.19.pli: Evañca so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi vuccamāno tatheva paggaṇheyya, so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsitabbo tassa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.19.eng: If that monk continues as before, the monks should press him up to three times to make him stop.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.20.pli: Yāvatatiyañce samanubhāsiyamāno taṃ paṭinissajjeyya, iccetaṃ kusalaṃ;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.20.eng: If he then stops, all is well.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.21.eng: If he does not stop, he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.6.eng: those belonging to the same Buddhist sect and staying within the same monastery zone.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.6.comm: “Monastery zone” renders sīmā. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.8.pli: “kathaṃ ime nānā assu, vinā assu, vaggā assū”ti pakkhaṃ pariyesati, gaṇaṃ bandhati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.8.eng: thinking, “What can I do to split, separate, and divide them?” he searches for a faction and puts together a group.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.9.eng: A legal issue conducive to schism:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.9.comm: For these eighteen grounds, see Kd 17:5.2.3.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.13.comm: In the rule “taking up” renders both samādāya and paggayha. As a consequence, the two terms are here rendered in the same way.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.18.eng: the monk who is pursuing schism in the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.20.pli: aññehi bhikkhūhi. Ye passanti, ye suṇanti, tehi vattabbo—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.20.eng: other monks, those who see it or hear it. They should correct him like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.21.pli: “māyasmā samaggassa saṅghassa bhedāya parakkami, bhedanasaṃvattanikaṃ vā adhikaraṇaṃ samādāya paggayha aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.21.eng: “Venerable, don’t pursue schism in the united Sangha or persist in taking up a legal issue conducive to schism.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.23.pli: Samaggo hi saṅgho sammodamāno avivadamāno ekuddeso phāsu viharatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.23.eng: for a united Sangha—in concord, in harmony, having a joint recitation—is at ease.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.24.eng: And they should correct him a second

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.26.eng: If he stops, all is well.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.27.eng: If he does not stop, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.28.eng: If those who hear about it do not say anything, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.29.eng: That monk, even if he has to be pulled into the Sangha, should be corrected like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.30.pli: “māyasmā samaggassa saṅghassa bhedāya parakkami, bhedanasaṃvattanikaṃ vā adhikaraṇaṃ samādāya paggayha aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.30.eng: “Venerable, don’t pursue schism in the united Sangha or persist in taking up a legal issue conducive to schism.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.32.pli: Samaggo hi saṅgho sammodamāno avivadamāno ekuddeso phāsu viharatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.32.eng: for a united Sangha—in concord, in harmony, having a joint recitation—is at ease.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.33.eng: They should correct him a second

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.35.eng: If he stops, all is well.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.36.eng: If he does not stop, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.38.eng: “And, monks, he should be pressed like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.39.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.40.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.41.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu samaggassa saṅghassa bhedāya parakkamati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.41.eng: The monk so-and-so is pursuing schism in the united Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.42.eng: And he keeps on doing it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.43.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ samanubhāseyya tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.43.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should press him to make him stop.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.45.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.46.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu samaggassa saṅghassa bhedāya parakkamati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.46.eng: The monk so-and-so is pursuing schism in the united Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.47.eng: And he keeps on doing it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.48.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ samanubhāsati tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.48.eng: The Sangha presses him to make him stop.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.49.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno samanubhāsanā tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.49.eng: Any monk who approves of pressing him to make him stop should remain silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.50.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.51.eng: For the second time, I speak on this matter. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.52.eng: For the third time, I speak on this matter.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.53.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.54.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu samaggassa saṅghassa bhedāya parakkamati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.54.eng: The monk so-and-so is pursuing schism in the united Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.55.eng: And he keeps on doing it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.56.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ samanubhāsati tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.56.eng: The Sangha presses him to make him stop.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.57.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno samanubhāsanā tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.57.eng: Any monk who approves of pressing him to make him stop should remain silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.58.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.59.pli: Samanubhaṭṭho saṅghena itthannāmo bhikkhu tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.59.eng: The Sangha has pressed monk so-and-so to make him stop.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.60.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.62.eng: After the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.62.comm: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, an offense. Yet just below the text says that the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.63.eng: After each of the first two announcements, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.64.eng: When the last announcement is finished, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.65.pli: Saṅghādisesaṃ ajjhāpajjantassa ñattiyā dukkaṭaṃ, dvīhi kammavācāhi thullaccayā paṭippassambhanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.65.eng: For one who commits the offense entailing suspension, the offense of wrong conduct and the serious offenses are annulled.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.66.eng: He commits an offense entailing suspension:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.67.eng: … Therefore, too, it is called “an offense entailing suspension”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:3.1.1.pli: Dhammakamme dhammakammasaññī na paṭinissajjati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:3.1.1.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, and he does not stop, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:3.1.2.pli: Dhammakamme vematiko na paṭinissajjati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:3.1.2.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, and he does not stop, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:3.1.3.pli: Dhammakamme adhammakammasaññī na paṭinissajjati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:3.1.3.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as illegitimate, and he does not stop, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:3.1.4.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as legitimate, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:3.1.5.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:3.1.6.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:3.2.2.eng: if he has not been pressed;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:3.2.6.eng: if he is overwhelmed by pain;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:3.2.7.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:3.2.8.eng: The training rule on schism in the Sangha, the tenth, is finished.
